text: 1. That seems to be correct according to <https://support.hdfgroup.org/HDF5/doc/TechNotes/VLTypes.html>. You might be able to convert it to `FixedString` (a HDF5.jl type)

text: Thanks for the feedback!  Especially for pointing me to `HDF5.FixedString`, I didn't know about that.  Unfortunately, I couldn't figure out how to use it to write Julia `String`s as HDF fixed length strings.  It seems to be more focused on reading padded fixed length strings from HDF.  Is there some way of using it to write strings as fixed width padded strings that I'm not seeing?
